title: Are all logically equivalent propositions consistent? True or False? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are all logically equivalent propositions consistent? True or False? Just because propositions are logically equivalent, that does not mean they are true. Consider: All ravens are black.All not black things are not ravens.These two statements are logically equivalent. So I pull out a white handkerchief and say “This is not a raven.” I have proved that all ravens are black.

No. Contradictions are always false (so inconsistent, both internally and with anything else). Tautologies, on the other hand, are always true (so consistent with anything, whether equivalent or not). Contingents (sometimes T sometimes F) must be internally consistent to be possibly T, and so any equivalent must be consistent also.

Again, write the logic equations and solve: equivalence: p=>q and q=>p consistency: -((p=>-q) or(q=>-p)) we also assume: -((p=>q) and (p=>-q)) and vice-versa. then logical equivalence and consistency may be shown to be equivalent.
